trans-unit.source: Provides methods used to render a button control with or without visual styles.
This class cannot be inherited.
The ButtonRenderer class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render a button control.
Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control.
To draw a button, use one of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonRenderer.DrawButton%2A> methods.
These methods provide a variety of options, such as drawing text or an image on the button.

If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonRenderer.DrawButton%2A> will draw the button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonRenderer.DrawButton%2A> will draw the button with the classic Windows style.
This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should automatically match the current visual style setting of the operating system.

This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=fullName> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Button.PushButton?displayProperty=fullName> class.
For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Draws a button control in the specified state and bounds.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the button.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PushButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the button.
Draws a button control in the specified state and bounds, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the button.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle on the button; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PushButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the button.
Draws a button control in the specified state and bounds, with the specified image, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to draw on the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the dimensions of `image`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle on the button; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PushButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the button.
Draws a button control in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the button.
The <xref:System.String> to draw on the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to `buttonText`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle on the button; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PushButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the button.
Draws a button control in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text and text formatting, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the button.
The <xref:System.String> to draw on the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to `buttonText`.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values to apply to `buttonText`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle on the button; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PushButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the button.
Draws a button control in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text and image, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the button.
The <xref:System.String> to draw on the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to `buttonText`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to draw on the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the dimensions of `image`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle on the button; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PushButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the button.
Draws a button control in the specified state and bounds; with the specified text, text formatting, and image; and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the button.
The <xref:System.String> to draw on the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to `buttonText`.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values to apply to `buttonText`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to draw on the button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the dimensions of `image`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle on the button; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PushButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the button.
Draws the background of a control's parent in the specified area.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the background of the parent of `childControl`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which to draw the parent control's background.
This rectangle should be inside the child controlâ€™s bounds.
The control whose parent's background will be drawn.
Indicates whether the background of the button has semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.PushButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the button.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the background of the button has semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the renderer uses the application state to determine rendering style.

If the RenderMatchingApplicationState property is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonRenderer> uses the setting from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.RenderWithVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine the rendering style.
If RenderMatchingApplicationState is `false`, the renderer will always render using visual styles.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the application state is used to determine rendering style; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
